variant.question: Given two identical aeroplanes with wing mounted engines, one fitted with jet engines and the other with counter rotating propellers, which of these statements is correct about roll behaviour after an engine failure?

options.text: The propeller aeroplane has more roll tendency.
The propeller aeroplane has less roll tendency.
Both aeroplanes have the same roll tendency.
The roll tendency on the propeller powered aeroplane is more pronounced when the left engine fails than when the right engine fails.

variant.question: For a twin-engine aeroplane, a reason for limiting a propeller’s diameter is to..

options.text: avoid excessive propeller-tip velocities at high RPMs.
reduce the aeroplane’s minimum control speed.
increase ground clearance.
avoid a reduction in power absorption.
thrust and propeller efficiency are reduced
ice only accumulates on the middle third of the prop
rotational velocity is too high and ice doesn’t stick to the propeller
25% decrease in efficiency but thrust is unaffected in a power-on state
Propeller Icing can reduce propeller efficiency by up to 20%
Ice forms on the leading edge of the blade, towards the tip.
The loss of aircraft performance in icing conditions is mainly due to propeller icing.
Reducing propeller RPM will reduce the level of propeller icing

variant.question: A flight instructor is teaching a student of a multi-engine piston airplane the practice of an engine failure. What is the most favourable configuration during the first engine failure exercise?

options.text: An airplane mass of 4 400 lbs so that the rudder has greater effectiveness.
An airplane mass of 4 400 lbs so that the resultant yaw from the engine failure is minimized.
An airplane mass of 3 800 lbs so that the rudder has greater effectiveness.
An airplane mass of 3 800 lbs so that the resultant yaw from the engine failure is minimized.

variant.question: A flight instructor is teaching a student of a multi-engine piston airplane the practice of an engine failure. What is the most favourable configuration during the first engine failure exercise?

options.text: An airplane mass of 4 400 lbs so that the rudder has greater effectiveness.
An airplane mass of 3 800 lbs so that the resultant yaw from the engine failure is minimized.
An airplane mass of 4 400 lbs so that the resultant yaw from the engine failure is minimized.
An airplane mass of 3 800 lbs so that the rudder has greater effectiveness.

variant.question: A twin engine jet transport aeroplane is taking off from runway 27 with a wind of 210°/15 kt and an outside Air Temperature (OAT) of 20 °C. The failure of which engine would require the largest control inputs to maintain runway centreline?

options.text: Failure of the left engine.
It makes no difference.
It depends on the direction of rotation of the engines.
Failure of the right engine.

variant.question: A twin engine jet transport aeroplane is taking off from runway 27 with a wind of 210°/15 kt and an outside Air Temperature (OAT) of 20 °C. The failure of which engine would require the largest control inputs to maintain runway centreline?

options.text: Failure of the left engine.
